events¶

class events.AxisMoved(x_axis_pos, y_axis_pos)[source]¶

This event stores position of a game pad axis. Values of the axis position can be between -1 and 1 with 0 value, when it’s centered. Bottom right corner is (1,1).

Attributes:
  • x_axis_pos (float): x value of axis position
  • y_axis_pos (float): y value of axis position
class events.Event[source]¶

This is a superclass for any events that might be generated by an object and sent to the EventManager.

class events.EventManager[source]¶

This class is responsible for coordinating most communication between the game systems.

This class and the idea of event driven architecture was taken from sjbrown’s Writing Games Tutorial.

Attributes:
  • listener (): registered listeners
post(event)[source]¶

Pass an event to all registered listeners of this event manger.

Parameters:event (Event) – event that will be passed
register_listener(listener)[source]¶

Register a listener to this event manager. Listener must contain notify() method.

Parameters:listener – listener to register
unregister_listener(listener)[source]¶

Unregister a listener of this event manager.

Parameters:listener – listener to unregister
class events.HatMoved(x, y)[source]¶

This event stores position of a game pad hat. Position of the hat are two values which can be 0, 1 or -1. A value of -1 means left/down and a value of 1 means right/up.

Attributes:
  • x (int): x value of hat position
  • y (int): y value of hat position
class events.KeyPressed(key)[source]¶

This event stores the pressed key. Is send when event of type pygame.KEYDOWN is occurs.

Attributes:
  • key (): pressed key
class events.KeyReleased(key)[source]¶

This event stores the released key.

Attributes:
  • key (): released key
class events.MouseMoved(x, y)[source]¶

Mouse moved event stores new position of mouse pointer on the screen.

Attributes:
  • x (int): x value of new mouse pointer position
  • y (int): y value of new mouse pointer position
class events.PlayerMoved(new_position)[source]¶

This event is sent every time when player moves. Is used in enemy AI and animation system.

Attributes:
  • new_position (2D list): new position of the player
class events.PlayerStoppedMovement[source]¶

This event is sent when player stops movement. Is used in enemy AI and animation system.

class events.QuitEvent[source]¶

Programm Quit Event. Is send when event of type pygame.QUIT is occurs.

class events.ResizeWindowEvent(width, height)[source]¶

Resize Window Event. Is send when event of type pygame.VIDEORESIZE is occurs.

Attributes:
  • width (int): New width of the window
  • height (int) New height of the window
class events.TickEvent(dt)[source]¶

CPU Tick event will be send every frame.

Attributes:
  • dt (int): Time expired since CPU Tick
class events.UpdateImagePosition(entity_ID, new_position)[source]¶

Occurs when entity has moved and image position has to be updated.

Attributes:
  • entity_ID (int): entity that has been moved
  • new_position (int tuple): new position
